R0054.title: Malicious Returns
R0054.definition: A buyer returns goods not for legitimate reasons, but to disrupt the seller or platform, or to gain improper benefits.
R0054.description: A buyer purchases high-value, large, or scarce items with the intent to disrupt or damage, then initiates a return as soon as the goods arrive or before they arrive, causing financial loss or reputational damage to the seller through high return rates. Alternatively, a buyer uses the 7-day no-questions-asked return policy on high-value items after using them, causing depreciation, then colluding with insiders to purchase the depreciated item.
R0054.influence: Consumes the seller's profits, inventory, reputation, or supply chain costs.

references.title: Buyer Uses Courier Tracking Number for Malicious Refund of Nearly 40,000 Yuan, Faces Fraud Charges

R0054-001.title: Bulk Refunds
R0054-001.definition: Placing bulk orders through the same or different accounts and initiating illegitimate bulk returns or refunds.
R0054-001.description: Using automated or manual means to place large numbers of orders or high-value orders, then bulk-canceling and requesting refunds, maliciously consuming supply chain costs or causing the seller's return rate to rise.
R0054-001.influence: Disrupts the seller's normal operations, causing supply chain losses or a drop in ratings and rankings.

references.title: What Dark Secrets Lie Behind Bulk Returns to E-Commerce Merchants?

R0054-002.title: Return Fraud
R0054-002.definition: A buyer returns a counterfeit, used, empty, incomplete, or substitute item instead of the original purchased product.
R0054-002.description: The returned item is not the actual item that was shipped â€” such as returning a counterfeit or a different product (buy A, return B). The quantity of returned items differs from what was actually shipped, including empty packages.
R0054-002.influence: Causes financial loss to the platform or seller.

references.title: Online Merchant Hires People to Brush Orders and Return Goods, Faking Damage to Commit Insurance Fraud
What Are the Consequences of Fake Returns on Taobao? Woman Sentenced for Returning Empty Box

R0054-003.title: Flash Return Arbitrage
R0054-003.definition: Placing an order to receive gifts, vouchers, or discounts, then immediately canceling the order to extract the benefits.
R0054-003.description: A targeted fraudster may stockpile large numbers of accounts and monitor platform or merchant promotions in real time. Upon finding a profitable opportunity, they place bulk orders via automation, extract coupons, gifts, or other benefits, and then immediately cancel the orders for profit.
R0054-003.influence: Causes financial loss to the platform and sellers.

references.title: Exploiting Platform Flash Refund Rules: Order Brushing and Faking Returns Constitutes Fraud

R0054-004.title: Malicious Refusal of Delivery
R0054-004.definition: A buyer refuses to accept goods for retaliatory or disruptive purposes, occupying or consuming the seller's supply chain resources and causing financial loss.
R0054-004.description: A typical malicious attack scenario: a buyer purchases large items such as appliances, electronics, construction materials, or tires, then goes unreachable or refuses delivery when the courier arrives, occupying and consuming the seller's supply chain costs.
R0054-004.influence: Causes supply chain losses to the seller.

references.title: Experiencing Malicious Refusal of Delivery by a Xianyu Buyer
